section.title: Registering &rhla; with &rmt;
section.para: Use this procedure to register &rhel; &productnumber; with the &rmt; server.

listitem.para: The system you want to register can access the &rmt; server.
The system you want to register is running the latest minor release of &rhla; &productnumber;.
You have a &productname; subscription activated in the &scc;.
You have removed the system from any &rh; subscription services it was registered to.

procedure.title: Registering &rhla; with &rmt;
procedure.remark: Will need to fully re-test and update this procedure.

step.para: Disable the &rhla; repositories in /etc/yum.repos.d by setting enabled=0 in each .repo file.
Run the rmt-client-setup-res script with the URL of the &rmt; server as a parameter:
The script performs the following tasks:

listitem.para: Downloads and runs the rmt-client-setup script, which does the following:
Imports the keys with gpg --import and rpm --import.
Downloads the CA certificate from https://RMT_SERVER/rmt.crt.
Imports the CA certificate to the trust store.

step.para: If the script works, you will see Successfully registered system. If the script fails, see for potential solutions.
You should see the following output:
step.screen:
Installed Products: ------------------------------------------
SLES Expanded Support platform release file (RES/&productnumber;/x86_64)
Registered
------------------------------------------

step.para: You should see RES-&productnumber;-Updates, RES-AS-&productnumber;-Updates, and RES-CB-&productnumber;-Updates.

tip.para: To check whether the extension is available, run the &suseconnect; --list-extensions command.

step.para: Run the update command to make sure there are no errors:

section.para: You can now update your system from repositories provided by &productname;.
